dcterms:description: A dataset containing information on rural households that are not electrified, used to understand the electrification needs of villages in India.
dcterms:title: Rural households electrification

dcterms:creator: R. S. Sutton
A. G. Barto
dcterms:description: A mathematical framework for modeling optimal sequential decision-making problems under uncertainty, used to formulate the problem of minimizing demand-supply deficit in microgrids.
dcterms:title: Markov Decision Process (MDP)

dcterms:creator: S. S. S. R. Depuru
L. Wang
V. Devabhaktuni
dcterms:description: A dataset providing demand values for microgrids, used to inform decision-making in power supply management.
dcterms:title: Demand values for microgrids

dcterms:description: A probability transition matrix used to model the demand in the context of microgrids, part of the methodology rather than an external dataset.
dcterms:title: Probability transition matrix for Demand

dcterms:creator: D. Bertsekas
dcterms:description: An algorithm used for reinforcement learning, applied in the context of minimizing demand-supply deficit in microgrids.
dcterms:title: Q-learning algorithm

dcterms:creator: L. Busoniu
R. Babuska
B. De Schutter
dcterms:description: A cooperative multi-agent reinforcement learning approach applied to the problem of minimizing demand-supply deficit in microgrids.
dcterms:title: Multi-Agent Q-Learning
